intro: Lunaria biennis var. corcyraea, commonly known as the moonflower or silverweed, is a variant of the common hawksbeard. It is a biennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia, characterized by its distinctive silvery-blue flowers that bloom in the second year of growth. The plant features a basal rosette of leaves and tall, branched stems with yellow-green flowers that resemble small moons. Its botanical name reflects its historical use in herbal medicine and as a decorative plant. The species is also noted for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types and its role in supporting pollinators.
